definition: awkward/embarrassed/cannot be accomplished
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
(negative prefix)/not/no
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to be put on the spot/to find oneself in an awkward situation

sentences.english: Marty: He says Santa is too fat to come down our Chimney.
sentences.chinese: 他说圣诞老人太胖了，下不来我们的烟囱。

sentences.english: Watching movies is fun, but the ticket prices never go down.
sentences.chinese: 看电影真愉快，可惜票价下不来。

sentences.english: Because Fang Qiong cheated money, face on Monday, a hunger strike at home.
sentences.chinese: 方琼因为被骗了钱，面子上下不来，在家绝食抗议。

sentences.english: Your question stopped him in his tracks, ie disconcerted him.
sentences.chinese: 你提的问题让他当场下不来台。

sentences.english: Are you worried we beat her to make her galling?
sentences.chinese: 我是担心我们打败她令她下不来台吗？

sentences.english: The temperature won't fall these days.
He is in that tree. He can't get down.
sentences.chinese: 他在那棵树上，下不来了。

sentences.english: Jim can't get down from the tree. Can you help him?
sentences.chinese: 吉姆从树上下不来了。你能帮帮忙吗？

sentences.english: He says Santa is too fat to come down our Chimney.
sentences.chinese: 他说圣诞老人太胖了，下不来我们的烟囱。

sentences.english: I have just received a phone call, 3 months prior to the application of the loans years ago can't get down.
sentences.chinese: 我刚接到电话，3个月之前申请的贷款年前下不来了。

sentences.english: 'But then we couldn't get down again be-cause the door was locked.
sentences.chinese: 西里尔说，“可是我们下不来了，因为门被锁上了。”

sentences.english: What goes up never comes down.
The kitten climbed the tree and couldn't get down.
sentences.chinese: 那只小猫爬上树但下不来了。

sentences.english: Your remarks were much too harsh for him to swallow with good grace.
sentences.chinese: 你的话说得太重，弄得他下不来台了。

sentences.english: Thee boy climbed up the tree and couldn't get down.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩爬上树，却下不来了。

to be unable to reach
full to the point of bursting/(coll.) at most
luckily/fortunately
to fall to one's death
to be not less than (a certain quantity, amount etc)
to be unable to bear or support
not worth it
to crush to death
cannot maintain (sth)/unable to keep/more likely than not/may well
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to make life difficult for/to embarrass/unable to make it through
to drop down/to fall
to climb up
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
